value.title: 'A moment to put country above party': Biden makes appeal to disaffected Republican and independent voters
value.excerpt: Joe Biden is making a clear attempt to appeal to disaffected Republicans and independent voters in the final weeks of the election, promising he'd be a president that would work hard not just for those who support him, but also for those who do not.

value.title: 'The president is likely toast': Trump's woes raise GOP fears of a blue wave
value.excerpt: "The president has had possibly the worst two-week stretch that a candidate could have going into the final month of an election," one Republican strategist said.

value.title: Joe Biden's 2020 appeal to the white working class can work. Just ask my dad.
value.excerpt: The fact that Biden might be succeeding with white noncoastal voters might surprise some on the actual coasts, but it doesnâ€™t surprise me.

value.title: Philadelphia judge rejects Trump's poll-watcher lawsuit
value.excerpt: A local judge on Friday rejected an effort by the Trump campaign to send poll watchers to voting sites in Philadelphia, ruling that the campaign's attempted poll-watching isn't allowed under state law.

value.title: On economic aid, Trump seems to realize he 'messed up tactically'
value.excerpt: It dawned on the oft-confused president that sabotaging himself in the final four weeks of re-election campaign wasn't such a good idea.

value.title: What Makes Mike Penceâ€™s Complicity So Chilling
value.excerpt: Somewhere under the cornfields and backyard hoop courts of Indiana is a small black box holding the conscience of Vice President Mike Pence. He buried it four years ago, when a tape emerged of Donald Trump boasting about sexually assaulting women.

value.title: Biden says he'll answer court-packing question 'when the election is over'
value.excerpt: Democratic presidential nominee Joe Biden again ducked questions Thursday about whether he would seek to add seats to the Supreme Court, telling reporters he would not address the issue until after the November 3 election.

value.title: Pence does his best but Harris won't let him explain away Trump's failures
value.excerpt: Vice President Mike Pence tried his best on Wednesday to recast the reality of Donald Trump's presidency, but Sen. Kamala Harris, the Democratic pick for his job, refused to let him spin away the nation's current dire plight during their single debate.

value.title: Analysis: This is Vice President Mike Pence's answer on a peaceful transfer of power. Read it carefully.
value.excerpt: The vice presidential debate Wednesday night will be remembered more for how the candidates evaded questions than how they answered them.

value.title: A Fly Landed on Mike Pence
value.excerpt: A local TV news reporter from California clocked the flyâ€™s screen time on Mr. Penceâ€™s head at 2 minutes, 3 seconds. While Mr. Pence spent most of the 90-minute debate avoiding direct questions posed by the moderator,

value.title: Pence attacks Biden for failing to rescue Kayla Mueller, who was held hostage by ISIS.
value.excerpt: Vice President Mike Pence brought the parents of Kayla Mueller, the human rights activist who was killed in 2015 by members of the Islamic State in Syria, to the debate hall and attacked Joseph R. Biden Jr.

value.title: Biden crosses 270 threshold in CNN's Electoral College outlook for first time
value.excerpt: Joe Biden is surging in the battle for the White House with less than four weeks to go until Election Day.

value.title: Biden campaign mulls possible 'climate czar' position
value.excerpt: A Biden administration would seek to rejoin the Paris Climate Accord. This website uses cookies to enhance user experience and to analyze performance and traffic on our website. We also share information about your use of our site with our social media,

value.title: Pence plays Covid defense and other things to watch at the vice presidential debate
value.excerpt: Itâ€™s the former radio host (turned governor) vs. the former prosecutor (turned senator) in Salt Lake City Wednesday for the first and only vice presidential debate.

value.title: The Relief Deal Blowup: What are Pelosi and Trump Thinking?
value.excerpt: Itâ€™s not just the presidentâ€™s wild back-and-forth on Twitter. Both sides are looking irrational on a deal that the economy is going to need soon.

value.title: Former CIA Director Hayden backs Biden, warns reelecting Trump would be 'very bad' for America
value.excerpt: Former CIA and NSA Director Michael Hayden on Wednesday warned that reelecting President Donald Trump would be "very bad for America" while endorsing Democratic nominee Joe Biden for president.

value.title: Stimulus latest: Trump tweets halt negotiations, meaning federal help for millions is not coming anytime soon
value.excerpt: President Donald Trump abruptly -- and single-handedly -- short-circuited stimulus negotiations on Tuesday, only to appear to reverse course eight hours later in a pair of tweets.

value.title: Russia's Vladimir Putin says he has noted Joe Biden's 'sharp anti-Russian rhetoric'
value.excerpt: Russian President Vladimir Putin said on Wednesday he had noted what he called harsh anti-Russian rhetoric from Democratic presidential candidate Joe Biden, but that he had been encouraged by Bidenâ€™s comments on arms control.

value.title: â€˜Iâ€™m mayor firstâ€™: In Miami-Dade, walking a line between Trump and constituents
value.excerpt: The Republican mayor of Miami-Dade County is a Trump-endorsed congressional candidate in a nationally watched swing seat. Heâ€™s also the elected leader of the urban heart of South Florida, a coronavirus hot spot thatâ€™s home to 2.

value.title: Mike Pence Brought Conservatives Home. What If They Donâ€™t Need Him Anymore?
value.excerpt: Evangelical Christians were drawn to the vice president because he shared their values. But Trumpâ€™s style has made defiance of political norms, not a Pence specialty, seem appealing.

value.title: Biden says United States is in a 'dangerous place' and calls for unity in Gettysburg speech
value.excerpt: Democratic presidential nominee Joe Biden warned of the "cost of division" Tuesday in a speech in Gettysburg, Pennsylvania, delivering a call to turn past a moment he said is "neither good nor normal" and unify.

value.title: The Point: Donald Trump, dealmaker? Not so much.
value.excerpt: Donald Trump came to the White House promising that he would make deals the likes of which the country and the world never seen.

value.title: Pence team objects to plexiglass being installed for both candidates at VP debate
value.excerpt: Mike Pence does not want plexiglass barriers around him at the vice presidential debate against Kamala Harris on Wednesday, a top aide to the vice president told CNN on Tuesday, rebuffing an announcement from the Commission on Presidential debates that the dividers would be used to prevent the spread

value.title: Tim Kaine on What Itâ€™s Like to Debate Mike Pence
value.excerpt: Mr. Kaine, Hillary Clintonâ€™s running mate in 2016, spoke to The Times about what lies ahead for Senator Kamala Harris at Wednesdayâ€™s V.P. debate.

value.title: Fact check: Trump falsely tweets that Covid-19 is less lethal than the flu
value.excerpt: President Donald Trump has consistently downplayed the threat of the coronavirus in public, and it seems testing positive for the virus himself has not changed his tune.

value.title: Bernstein on Trump: He has become homicidally negligent
value.excerpt: CNN political analyst Carl Bernstein reacts to the White House declining an offer from the CDC to help contact trace the coronavirus outbreak in the White House.

value.title: Michelle Obama releases closing campaign message: Vote for Biden 'like your lives depend on it'
value.excerpt: Former first lady Michelle Obama is making her closing message to Americans in a campaign video released less than one month until Election Day, imploring people to vote as she shares why she believes the stakes are so high this year.

value.title: Trump mounts bizarre and misleading White House return despite warnings
value.excerpt: A strongly medicated President Donald Trump bolted from his VIP hospital bubble Monday, staging a bizarre White House comeback that included an irresponsible mask removal and a reckless pronouncement there is nothing to fear from Covid-19, which has already killed 210,000 Americans.

value.title: Biden describes the first debate as a 'clownish undertaking'
value.excerpt: Joe Biden was asked about his first debate with President Trump, and if he could stand up to his opponent in the future. He said the debate frustrated him but should have described it as a "clownish undertaking" instead of calling the president a clown.

value.title: Trump off the air in Ohio and Iowa as polls show tight races in both states
value.excerpt: President Donald Trump's campaign canceled its planned television advertising in Iowa and Ohio this week, focusing its spending on states where Trump is behind even as polls show he is neck-and-neck with Democratic challenger Joe Biden in the two Midwestern states.
